>
> In the Ark, Quickstride and Night Shift have the CR chambers ready for use as they do last minute evaluations on the system. With a thumbs up from Night Shift, the CR Chambers are made ready to accept new patients.

As Quickstride and Night Shift finish thier work they can see the
inert forms of Windlord and Nightlight in two of the recharge
chambers, the chambers are set for a slow heal. So far their lights
are showing green and their vital signs appear to be strengthening.

Airhammer and Noctorro glanced at each other as it seemed that
Quickstride and Night Shift were ignoring them, and there are few
people who could ignore a Maximal of Noctorro's size.

"Answer me!" Noctorro said as his hands flexed slightly, and his
horned head turned to look directly at Quickstride and then Night
Shift, "What's happening with Rodimus?" It was obvious that Noctorro's
quick tempor starting to get the best of him, and for some reason he
expected Rodimus to be in here.

Airhammer tried to lay a calming hand on his fuzor brother, but
Noctorro shook it off.



> "If he does that there's no telln' if he'll survive such a proceedure. Lord Elder, tell him he can't do that! That's like the ultimate saccrifice and there's a great chance he'll die from it!"

"Why don't we let the medical staff decide if Rodimus requires a spark
infusion of some sort." Elder said, his voice over the radio calm and
reasoning. "I am sure that they are working on him now to the best of
their abilities."

Even as Elder was talking the doors to the bridge slid open and he
stepped onto the bridge followed by a much more calm Cheetor. "Hey Rat
Trap." Cheetor said as he stepped in and looked around, "Tuscon Prime
ready to come aboard?"

Meanwhile the computer continued to blink at Rat Trap, asking him if
he wanted to take manual control as the computer continued to try and
target lock Perceptor.

(OOC: Sorry if i overlooked it, but it seemed as if Rat Trap said they
were good, but made no actually attempt to shut the weaponry down?)

In the medical chamber . . .

> Kup watched sadly the medic room and said to silverbolt "I guess that i'll
> remain here to help"

Silverbolt tugged slightly on Kup's arm, "Kup, we are warriors not
Doctors." he said, somehow making that sound noble. He smiled at Kup,
"Niether one of us have the medical training to help here." He pointed
to the observation room. "We can watch from there, but at least we
won't be getting in the way, and if they need us, we are right there."

As Silverbolt talked Bump and Santon began to scan Rodimus,
positioning him on the bed. Legacy stood off to one side as he watched
the computer, analyzing the readouts.

*   *   *   *

"Interesting." Legacy said as he looked dispassionately at the screen,
pointedly ignoreing Kup and Silverbolt at the moment in favor of the
medical proceedure that would soon begin.

"What?" Santon said shortly as he was placing his tools in position
for the upcoming proceedure.

"It would seem that the tendrils have penatrated into nearly every
system Rodimus has." Legacy said as he turned to look at Rodimus, "but
they seem to be disintergrating."

Santon looked at his scanner, "Agreed." he said, "We cannot place him
in a recharge chamber yet, since we don't know what affect that could
have on these things." Bump said, sounding disgusted by the tendrils,
"But I think we can start cutting them away."

Santon nodded, "Then let's get started - carefully." he said,
emphasizing that last word, "We don't know what these things can still
do."

Legacy nodded as they all began to carefully cut away the metallic
wrapping that enveloped Rodimus, working slowly and carefully.

(TAG)

Preston
